snippet: Scores of people are thought to have been killed by extremist gunmen in one village in northern Iraq after refusing to convert to Islam, an incident likely to heighten international concern about the plight of Iraq’s Yazidi minority.
abstract: Scores of people in Kocho, Iraq, are thought to have been killed by Islamic States in Iraq and Syria militants after refusing to convert to Islam, incident likely to heighten international concern about the plight of Iraq’s Yazidi minority.

byline.original: By BEN HUBBARD and AZAM AHMED
byline.contributor: Ben Hubbard reported from Baghdad, and Azam Ahmed from Khazir, Iraq.

lead_paragraph: Scores of people are thought to have been killed by extremist gunmen in one village in northern Iraq after refusing to convert to Islam, an incident likely to heighten international concern about the plight of Iraq’s Yazidi minority.
